tokens.resolved_gloss: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)

tokens.resolved_gloss: a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
tokens.translation: a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock

tokens.resolved_gloss: literally one officiating, a priest; also (by courtesy) an acting priest (although a layman)
tokens.translation: literally one officiating, a priest; also (by courtesy) an acting priest (although a layman)

tokens.resolved_gloss: to visit (with friendly or hostile intent); by analogy, to oversee, muster, charge, care for, miss, deposit, etc.
tokens.translation: to visit (with friendly or hostile intent); by analogy, to oversee, muster, charge, care for, miss, deposit, etc.

tokens.resolved_gloss: above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

tokens.resolved_gloss: a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb

tokens.resolved_gloss: to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
